str2: (a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From sun and ago; to lead together, i.e. Collect or convene; specially, to entertain.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be away from home, go into another country, be away, be abroad. From apodemos; to go abroad, i.e. Visit a foreign land.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Long, distant, far; of long duration. From mekos; long (distant) or time (neuter plural).
Feminine of a derivative of the base of chasma through the idea of empty expanse; room, i.e. A space of territory.
(a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From dia and skorpizo; to dissipate, i.e. to rout or separate; specially, to winnow; figuratively, to squander.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Property, wealth, substance. From the feminine of on; substance, i.e. Property.
Prodigally, with prodigal living, wastefully. Adverb from the same as asotia; dissolutely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
